content: mercury socks by kim mckenzie matildawormwood on ravelry inspired by the craters of planet mercury you ll love knitting and wearing this cuffdown sock with a simple lace pattern materials  yarn approximately 325-425yds of light fingering weight or fingering weight sock yarn yarn pictured malabrigo sock in persia 852  needles set of 5 dpns in whatever needle size you need to obtain gauge i used 2 25mm size 1 but recommended needle size ranges from 00-2 1 75mm to 2 75mm this pattern is easy to modify into magic loop using one long circular needle instead of dpns  stitch holder  darning needle sizes available  xs s m l yields a sock with an ankle measurement of approximately 5 6 7 8 5 inches unstretched due to the nature of the lace fabric created there is considerable stretch to comfortably accommodate an ankle circumference of approximately 7 8 9 10 5 inches or greater gauge  10 stitches/15 row in lace stitch pattern = 1 inch square cuff using the german twisted cast on method cast on 48 60 72 84 stitches join the stitches in the round divide stitches evenly onto four dpns each needle holding 12 15 18 21 knit cuff as a rib of k k p * repeat to end leg once ribbed cuff is 1 long switch to the lace pattern knit in lace pattern repeated 8 10 12 14 times around the leg round 1 k k2tog yo k2 p * repeat to end round 2 k5 p * repeat to end round 3 k2tog yo k yo ssk p * repeat to end round 4 k5 p * repeat to end round 5 k5 p * repeat to end continue working rounds 1-5 until leg measures 6 inches once the leg measures 6 inches long or desired length complete through round 5 of the lace pattern and then prepare to knit the heel flap lace pattern chart key - 5 knit - 4 purl - - \ о о / 3 о yarn over - 2 knit two together k2tog / - о / 1 slip slip knit ssk \ heel flap knit the first 24 30 36 42 stitches onto a single dpn then place the remaining 24 30 36 42 stitches on a stitch holder work the stitches on the heel flap back and forth as follows row 1 wrong side slip 1 stitch knitwise p to end row 2 right side slip 1 stitch knitwise k * repeat to end repeat until heel flap is desired length for many people that will be about 2 5in but for people with a taller instep you might want to knit it as long as 3in end after completing a wrong side row to prepare for turning the heel turn heel row 1 rs slip 1 k 13 16 19 22 stitches ssk k1 turn row 2 ws slip 1 p5 p2tog p1 turn row 3 rs slip 1
